*.description: Custom shell commands shown when right-clicking on the desktop or folder background.

ButtonFace.description: Specifies the RGB color for button backgrounds.

ButtonText.description: Specifies the RGB color for button text.

Window.description: Specifies the RGB color for the window background.

WindowText.description: Specifies the RGB color for window text.

AutoEndTasks.description: Determines whether the system automatically closes applications that are not responding during shutdown.

CursorBlinkRate.description: Controls the text cursor blink rate in milliseconds.

DragFullWindows.description: Controls whether window contents are shown while dragging.

FontSmoothing.description: Enables or disables font smoothing (anti-aliasing) for on-screen text.

FontSmoothingType.description: Specifies the type of font smoothing used.

ForegroundLockTimeout.description: Specifies how long (in milliseconds) the system waits before allowing a background window to take focus.

HungAppTimeout.description: Determines how long the system waits (in milliseconds) for an unresponsive application before prompting to close it.

MenuShowDelay.description: Sets the delay (in milliseconds) before a menu is displayed after being pointed at.

SCRNSAVE.EXE.description: Specifies the path to the screen saver executable file.

ScreenSaveActive.description: Determines whether the screen saver is active.

ScreenSaveTimeOut.description: Specifies the idle time (in seconds) before the screen saver activates.

TileWallpaper.description: Specifies whether the wallpaper is tiled across the desktop.

UserPreferencesMask.description: Binary configuration data that stores user interface effects (animations, shadows, etc.).

WaitToKillAppTimeout.description: Specifies the time (in milliseconds) the system waits before ending user processes during shutdown.

Wallpaper.description: Specifies the path to the current desktop wallpaper image.

WallpaperStyle.description: Determines how the desktop wallpaper is displayed (stretched, centered, tiled, etc.).

WindowArrangementActive.description: Determines whether window snapping (Aero Snap) is enabled.

Path.description: User-specific PATH variable, appended to the system PATH during process creation.

TEMP.description: Specifies the current user's temporary file directory.

TMP.description: Duplicate or alternate temporary directory variable.

Enabled.description: Specifies whether the advertising ID is enabled for the current user.

Reindexed.description: Indicates whether File Explorer has reindexed the user’s Quick Access links.

ShowFrequent.description: Controls whether frequently used folders appear in Quick Access.

ShowRecent.description: Controls whether recent files are displayed in Quick Access.

AutoCheckSelect.description: Enables checkboxes for selecting multiple items in Explorer.

DontUsePowerShellOnWinX.description: Replaces PowerShell with Command Prompt in the Win+X (right-click Start) menu.

EnableBalloonTips.description: Enables or disables system notification balloon tips.

EnableSnapAssistFlyout.description: Controls Snap Layouts popup when hovering over maximize button.

Hidden.description: Controls whether hidden files and folders are shown in File Explorer.

HideFileExt.description: Hides or shows file extensions for known file types.

ListviewAlphaSelect.description: Controls translucent selection effects in File Explorer list views.

SeparateProcess.description: Determines whether each File Explorer window runs in its own process.

ShowCompColor.description: Shows compressed or encrypted files in an alternate color.

TaskbarAnimations.description: Enables or disables taskbar animation effects.

TaskbarSmallIcons.description: Determines whether the taskbar uses small or standard icons.

UseOLEDTaskbarTransparency.description: Enables high-transparency (Acrylic-like) taskbar on supported systems.

Settings.description: Stores binary taskbar position and layout settings (e.g., top/bottom/left/right alignment).

NoControlPanel.description: Prevents access to Control Panel and Settings app.

NoFolderOptions.description: Hides the Folder Options menu in File Explorer.

NoLogoff.description: Removes the Log Off option from the Start menu.

Preferences.description: Binary blob that stores column visibility, tab positions, and view preferences for Task Manager.

StartUpTab.description: Specifies which tab Task Manager opens on by default (e.g., Performance, Details).

AccentColor.description: Specifies the RGB color value for accent color on UI elements.

ColorPrevalence.description: Controls whether accent color is applied to title bars and window borders.

Composition.description: Enables or disables the Desktop Window Manager (DWM).

EnableAeroPeek.description: Controls whether Aero Peek (desktop preview) is enabled.

*.description: Contains registered right-click (context menu) command definitions.

Common Startup.description: Specifies the physical folder path where startup shortcuts for all users are stored.

AllowTelemetry.description: Controls diagnostic and usage data level sent to Microsoft.

LinkResolveIgnoreLinkInfo.description: Disables resolving .lnk file paths using LinkInfo data.

NoControlPanel.description: Hides or disables Control Panel access.

NoLowDiskSpaceChecks.description: Disables low disk space warning pop-ups.

NoResolveTrack.description: Prevents automatic correction of broken shortcuts.

ConsentPromptBehaviorAdmin.description: Defines UAC prompt behavior for administrators.

values.1: Prompt for credentials on secure desktop
values.2: Prompt for consent on secure desktop
values.5: Prompt for consent for non-Windows binaries

DisableCAD.description: Removes the requirement to press Ctrl+Alt+Del before logging on.

DontDisplayLastUserName.description: Hides the name of the last user who logged on at the logon screen.

values.1: Do not display last user name

EnableInstallerDetection.description: Determines whether the system detects installer programs and requests elevation automatically.

EnableSecureUIAPaths.description: Enforces secure paths for UI Automation accessibility applications.

EnableVirtualization.description: Controls file and registry virtualization for legacy applications that write to protected locations.

LegalNoticeCaption.description: Specifies the title of the legal notice displayed before logon.

LegalNoticeText.description: Specifies the text of the legal notice displayed before logon.

PromptOnSecureDesktop.description: Specifies whether elevation prompts appear on the secure desktop or the user's desktop.

*.description: Specifies applications that automatically start for all users at system startup.
Programs listed here run once for all users at the next system startup and are then removed.
Lists installed applications and their uninstall information.

Auto.description: Controls whether the debugger automatically launches on crash.

Debugger.description: Specifies the debugger command line to run on application crash.

DiagTrackAuthorization.description: Controls whether diagnostics data can be uploaded to Microsoft.

PerformanceScenarioTracking.description: Enables or disables internal Windows performance scenario logging.

*.description: Allows attaching a debugger to specific executables or globally overriding their behavior.

NetworkThrottlingIndex.description: Controls throttling of multimedia streaming over the network (FFFFFFFF disables).

SystemResponsiveness.description: Specifies how responsive Windows is to foreground tasks vs background multimedia streams.

DevicePasswordLessBuildVersion.description: Enables or disables passwordless sign-in using Microsoft Hello or PIN.

EnablePrefetcher.description: Controls prefetching for faster application and system startup.

*.description: Configures behavior when monitored processes exit silently or unexpectedly.

DisableSR.description: Disables the Windows System Restore feature.

AutoRestartShell.description: Automatically restarts the Windows shell (Explorer.exe) if it crashes.

DefaultDomainName.description: Specifies the domain or local computer name for automatic login.

DefaultPassword.description: Specifies the password for automatic login (stored in plain text).

DefaultUserName.description: Specifies the username used for automatic login.

DontDisplayLastUserName.description: Hides the last logged-in username on the login screen for security.

GinaDLL.description: Specifies a custom GINA DLL for handling logon authentication. Deprecated in modern Windows.

Shell.description: Specifies the program used as the default shell. Default is explorer.exe.

Userinit.description: Specifies programs that run automatically when a user logs on. Default includes userinit.exe.

BootDriverFlags.description: Bitmask flags controlling how boot drivers are loaded during startup.

ServicesPipeTimeout.description: Defines how long the Service Control Manager waits for services to start before timing out (in milliseconds).

SvcHostSplitThresholdInKB.description: Controls memory thresholds for splitting svchost.exe instances. Higher values combine services to reduce memory use.

WaitToKillServiceTimeout.description: Time in milliseconds that Windows waits for services to stop before forcing termination during shutdown.

AutoReboot.description: Specifies whether the system automatically restarts after a crash.

CrashDumpEnabled.description: Specifies whether Windows creates a memory dump when the system crashes.

DumpFile.description: Specifies the path where memory dump files are written. Default is %SystemRoot%\MEMORY.DMP.

MinidumpDir.description: Specifies the directory for small memory dump files (minidumps).

Overwrite.description: Determines whether existing dump files are overwritten automatically.

SendAlert.description: When enabled, sends an administrative alert when a system crash occurs.

LogEvent.description: When enabled, logs crash dump generation events to the system event log.

NtfsDisableLastAccessUpdate.description: Disables updating the last access timestamp on files and folders.

NtfsMemoryUsage.description: Adjusts how much memory NTFS uses for metadata and caching.

Win31FileSystem.description: Allows legacy 8.3 filename creation for backward compatibility.

TdrDelay.description: Number of seconds Windows waits before considering GPU unresponsive.

TdrLevel.description: Timeout Detection and Recovery level for the GPU driver.

Attributes.description: Controls the visibility of advanced power settings in the Control Panel.

CsEnabled.description: Indicates whether the system supports and allows Connected Standby (Modern Standby).

HibernateEnabled.description: Determines whether hibernation is enabled on the system.

HiberFileType.description: Specifies the type of hibernation file: full or reduced.

HiberbootEnabled.description: Controls Fast Startup feature. When enabled, Windows uses hybrid boot to resume faster.

BootExecute.description: Lists system commands executed during boot (default includes autochk).

CriticalSectionTimeout.description: Timeout value for critical section deadlock detection (in milliseconds).

PendingFileRenameOperations.description: Specifies files to be renamed or deleted after reboot (used by installers).

*.description: Each subkey represents a system service or driver configuration. Contains settings such as Start, Type, and ImagePath.

CacheHashTableSize.description: Specifies the size of the DNS resolver cache hash table.

MaxCacheTtl.description: Maximum time (in seconds) a positive DNS record is cached.

MaxNegativeCacheTtl.description: Maximum time (in seconds) a failed DNS query (negative response) is cached.

AutoShareWks.description: Controls automatic creation of administrative shares (C$, D$, ADMIN$).

EnableAuthenticateUserSharing.description: Determines whether password-protected sharing is required.

SrvComment.description: Specifies the server description (visible to other computers in the network).

DefaultTTL.description: Default Time-to-Live (TTL) for outgoing IP packets.

DhcpNameServer.description: DNS servers obtained automatically via DHCP.

EnableDeadGWDetect.description: Enables detection and failover when the default gateway becomes unavailable.

EnableICMPRedirect.description: Determines whether TCP/IP accepts ICMP redirect packets to update routing tables.

EnableIPv6.description: Determines whether IPv6 is enabled on the system.

EnablePMTUDiscovery.description: Controls Path MTU Discovery to determine optimal packet size.

EnableRSS.description: Controls Receive-Side Scaling to distribute network load across CPU cores.

EnableTCPA.description: Enables TCP Chimney Offload (hardware acceleration of TCP processing).

Hostname.description: Specifies the local computer name used by TCP/IP.

NameServer.description: Defines one or more DNS servers for name resolution (space- or comma-separated).

NV Domain.description: Stores the non-volatile version of the domain name.

NV Hostname.description: Stores the non-volatile version of the hostname (persisted name).

SearchList.description: Specifies a comma-separated list of DNS suffixes to use when resolving short names.

Tcp1323Opts.description: Enables TCP Window Scaling and Timestamps (RFC 1323).

TcpMaxConnectRetransmissions.description: Number of times TCP retransmits SYN before giving up on a connection attempt.

TcpMaxDataRetransmissions.description: Sets how many times TCP retransmits unacknowledged data before dropping the connection.

TcpTimedWaitDelay.description: Specifies how long (in seconds) TCP connections remain in TIME_WAIT state.

AllowTelemetry.description: Controls the level of diagnostic and telemetry data sent to Microsoft.

MaxTelemetryAllowed.description: Defines the maximum allowed telemetry level on managed devices.

DOMaxDownloadBandwidth.description: Specifies maximum download bandwidth (in KB/s) for Delivery Optimization.

DOMaxUploadBandwidth.description: Specifies maximum upload bandwidth (in KB/s) for Delivery Optimization.

DODownloadMode.description: Controls Delivery Optimization behavior for peer-to-peer update downloads.

DisableHelpSticker.description: Removes 'Get help' tips and promotional stickers from the UI.

DisableFeedback.description: Disables all feedback notifications and requests from Windows Feedback Hub.

NumberOfSIUFInPeriod.description: Specifies how many feedback prompts appear within a feedback period.

PeriodInNanoSeconds.description: Defines the length of the feedback period in nanoseconds.

AllowDomainPINLogon.description: Determines whether users can sign in to domain accounts using PIN or Hello.

BlockDomainPINLogon.description: Prevents domain accounts from signing in using PIN (Windows Hello).

BlockDomainPicturePassword.description: Prevents domain accounts from using picture passwords.

DisableAutomaticRestartSignOn.description: Prevents automatic user sign-in after updates or restart.

DoNotConnectToWindowsUpdateInternetLocat.description: Prevents the system from connecting to Microsoft’s public Windows Update servers.

TargetGroup.description: Specifies the target group name used by WSUS for update deployment classification.

TargetGroupEnabled.description: Specifies whether the WSUS target group policy is enabled.

WUServer.description: Specifies the address of the internal Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) server.

WUStatusServer.description: Specifies the URL where client computers send status reports for WSUS.

AUOptions.description: Defines how updates are installed automatically.

values.2: Notify for download and notify for install
values.3: Auto download and notify for install
values.5: Allow local admin to choose setting

NoAutoUpdate.description: Disables automatic updates when set to 1.

NoAutoRebootWithLoggedOnUsers.description: Prevents automatic restart if a user is currently logged on.

RebootRelaunchTimeout.description: Specifies the time (in minutes) before the system automatically restarts after updates.

RebootRelaunchTimeoutEnabled.description: Specifies whether the reboot relaunch timeout is enforced.

RescheduleWaitTime.description: Defines the number of minutes to wait before retrying a missed scheduled installation.

ScheduledInstallDay.description: Specifies which day of the week updates are installed. 0 = Every day, 1–7 = Sunday–Saturday.

ScheduledInstallTime.description: Specifies the hour of the day (in 24-hour format) for automatic updates installation.

UseWUServer.description: Forces the client to use the specified WSUS server instead of Microsoft Update.

NextDetectionTime.description: Specifies the next scheduled time for Windows Update to check for updates.

Results.description: Stores the results of the last update detection run (internal use).

ScheduledInstallDate.description: Specifies the next scheduled date for automatic updates installation.

AllowAutoWindowsUpdateDownloadOverMetere.description: Allows Windows to download updates even when connected to a metered network.

DeferFeatureUpdatesPeriodInDays.description: Number of days to defer feature updates after their release.

DeferQualityUpdatesPeriodInDays.description: Number of days to defer quality (security) updates after their release.

FlightSettingsMaxDownloadLimit.description: Specifies the maximum allowed bandwidth percentage for update downloads on flighted builds.

LinkResolveIgnoreLinkInfo.description: Disables resolving .lnk file paths using LinkInfo data.

NoControlPanel.description: Hides or disables Control Panel access.

NoLowDiskSpaceChecks.description: Disables low disk space warning pop-ups.

NoResolveTrack.description: Prevents automatic correction of broken shortcuts.

DisableConsumerFeatures.description: Prevents Windows from installing consumer experiences and suggested apps.

DisableSoftLanding.description: Disables automatic sign-in suggestions and Microsoft account prompts.

DisableWindowsConsumerFeatures.description: Stops Windows from downloading consumer-oriented content after setup.

DisabledByGroupPolicy.description: Disables personalized advertising by turning off the advertising ID.

AutoConfigURL.description: Specifies the URL to a PAC (Proxy Auto-Config) script.

AutoDetect.description: Determines whether automatic proxy detection (WPAD) is enabled.

ProxyEnable.description: Determines whether a proxy server is used for HTTP/HTTPS connections.

ProxyOverride.description: Defines a list of addresses that bypass the proxy server.

ProxyServer.description: Specifies the address and port of the proxy server.

Common Startup.description: Specifies the physical folder path where startup shortcuts for all users are stored.
